summary: Political discrimination refers to the unjust treatment of individuals based on their political beliefs or affiliations, impacting their rights and freedoms within the EU framework. This concept is pivotal in ensuring that all citizens can participate in democratic processes without fear of reprisal or exclusion. EU legal instruments, such as the Charter of Fundamental Rights, emphasize the importance of non-discrimination, including political discrimination, as a fundamental principle.
